headline: Massachusetts May Take Control of Boston’s Public Schools
author: Roger Lowenstein
sentences:
Boston
Boston is a different city today than in 1974, when working-class whites rioted against a federal judge’s order to desegregate the schools via forced busing.
But one thing hasn’t changed: Boston still does a poor job of educating kids, especially the majority who are Hispanic and black.
In 2021, after decades of Irish and Italian mayors, voters put 36-year-old Michelle Wu in City Hall.
